availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin B. Sublett (Butler County, Kentucky, famer and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Butler County, Kentucky, famer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Jo Sublett. Father of Sarah Sublett, Andrew K. Sublett, Mahala J. Sublett, Mary D. Sublett, George Sublett, and Eliza Sublett. Married to Mary E. Gildersleve Sublett in Butler County, Kentucky, on January 10, 1856. Father to Elizabeth Sublett, Ellen Sublett, Jane A. Sublett, and Benjamin Bramblett Sublett. Farmer in Butler County in 1850. Farmer in Butler County in 1860. Justice of the peace for District 1 in Butler County in 1860. Removed from office in 1862.
